leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 可复现运行时与加速生态（容器/HPC）
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 环境→调度→缓存→追踪→加速
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 容器/调度 + 追踪/成本

tools.name: omnipkg
tools.one_line_profile: Python package and interpreter version manager wrapper for conda-forge
tools.detailed_description: A tool that simplifies the management of Python environments and packages using conda-forge, allowing for conflict-free installation of infinite package and interpreter versions.

tools.name: distrobox
tools.one_line_profile: Container wrapper to run any Linux distribution inside the terminal
tools.detailed_description: A tool that uses Podman or Docker to create containers using the Linux distribution of choice, enabling reproducible environments and backward/forward compatibility for scientific software on HPC or personal workstations.

tools.name: lilipod
tools.one_line_profile: Simple container manager for OCI images
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight container manager capable of downloading, unpacking, and using OCI images, serving as a minimal runtime for containerized scientific workflows.

tools.name: ACCESS-OM2
tools.one_line_profile: Global coupled ocean-sea ice model
tools.detailed_description: The ACCESS Ocean-Sea Ice Model (ACCESS-OM2), a global coupled model used for climate research and oceanography simulations.

tools.name: mSSA
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate Singular Spectrum Analysis for time series
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Multivariate Singular Spectrum Analysis (mSSA) for forecasting and imputation of multivariate time series data.

tools.name: Covalent
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow orchestration tool for HPC and quantum computing
tools.detailed_description: A Pythonic tool for orchestrating machine learning, high-performance computing (HPC), and quantum computing workflows across heterogeneous compute environments.

tools.name: Batch Shipyard
tools.one_line_profile: HPC and Batch workload management on Azure
tools.detailed_description: A tool to simplify deploying and managing High Performance Computing (HPC) and Batch workloads on Azure, supporting Docker and Singularity containers.

tools.name: cyclecloud-singularity
tools.one_line_profile: Singularity container support for Azure CycleCloud
tools.detailed_description: A project enabling the use of Singularity containers within HPC clusters managed by Azure CycleCloud, facilitating reproducible scientific workflows in the cloud.

tools.name: HPK
tools.one_line_profile: Kubernetes to Slurm/Singularity translator for HPC
tools.detailed_description: A tool that allows running Kubernetes applications within HPC environments by translating deployments to Slurm jobs and Singularity/Apptainer containers.

tools.name: KNoC
tools.one_line_profile: Kubernetes Virtual Kubelet for HPC clusters
tools.detailed_description: A Kubernetes Virtual Kubelet implementation that uses an HPC cluster as the container execution environment, bridging cloud-native and HPC workflows.

tools.name: hpc-container-wrapper
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper for HPC container installations
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to wrap software installations into containers specifically for use on HPC systems, simplifying deployment and execution.

tools.name: jupyter_environment_kernels
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter plugin for Conda/Virtualenv kernel detection
tools.detailed_description: A Jupyter plugin that enables automatic detection and management of Conda and virtualenv environments as kernels, facilitating reproducible scientific computing in notebooks.

tools.name: VR-Caps
tools.one_line_profile: Virtual environment for capsule endoscopy simulation
tools.detailed_description: A virtual reality environment for simulating active capsule endoscopy, used for training and testing control algorithms and medical analysis.

tools.name: ChangeMamba
tools.one_line_profile: Remote sensing change detection model
tools.detailed_description: A Spatio-Temporal State Space Model (Mamba) based approach for change detection in remote sensing imagery.

tools.name: ZigMa
tools.one_line_profile: Mamba-based diffusion model
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'ZigMa: A DiT-Style Mamba-based Diffusion Model', a generative model architecture for scientific or general image synthesis.

tools.name: COVIDStrategyCalculator
tools.one_line_profile: Epidemiological strategy assessment tool
tools.detailed_description: A standalone software tool to assess testing and quarantine strategies for COVID-19 management, supporting contact tracing and isolation logic.

tools.name: mach-nix
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to create highly reproducible Python environments using Nix
tools.detailed_description: A tool that simplifies the creation of reproducible Python environments by leveraging the Nix package manager, solving complex dependency management issues in scientific computing.

tools.name: cotainr
tools.one_line_profile: User-space Apptainer/Singularity container builder for HPC
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for High Performance Computing (HPC) users to build Apptainer/Singularity containers in user space without requiring privileged access.

tools.name: e4s-alc
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for customizing E4S container images
tools.detailed_description: E4S à la carte (e4s-alc) is a tool that enables users to customize container images by adding system packages and Spack packages, facilitating the creation of tailored HPC environments.

tools.name: e4s-cl
tools.one_line_profile: Container launcher and manager for E4S HPC applications
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to simplify the launch of MPI applications inside containers on HPC systems, handling library injection and inter-node communication transparently.

tools.name: LvArray
tools.one_line_profile: C++ template library for portable HPC array data structures
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library providing performance-portable array data structures and utilities designed for scientific simulations on HPC architectures (developed by GEOS-DEV).

tools.name: nd-Mamba2-torch
tools.one_line_profile: N-dimensional Mamba2 implementation in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library implementing the Mamba2 state space model with support for multi-dimensional data (1D/2D/3D), enabling the application of SSMs to scientific modeling tasks like vision or volumetric analysis.

tools.name: kube-mpi
tools.one_line_profile: MPI operator and runtime for HPC workloads on Kubernetes
tools.detailed_description: A prototype enabling High Performance Computing (HPC) developers to deploy stateful MPI-based applications (simulation, distributed deep learning) on container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.

tools.name: VM-UNet
tools.one_line_profile: Vision Mamba UNet model for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of VM-UNet, a medical image segmentation model integrating Vision Mamba blocks into a UNet architecture to capture long-range dependencies.

tools.name: Computer-Generated-Hologram
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation framework for computer-generated holography
tools.detailed_description: A framework for calculating and simulating computer-generated holograms (CGH), supporting recording and reproduction processes using MATLAB and Python.

tools.name: maru
tools.one_line_profile: CLI for containerizing scientific applications
tools.detailed_description: An opinionated command-line interface designed to simplify the process of containerizing scientific applications for reproducibility and deployment.

tools.name: Swin-UMamba
tools.one_line_profile: Mamba-based UNet model for biomedical image analysis
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model combining Swin Transformer and Mamba architectures for medical image segmentation tasks, with ImageNet-based pretraining.

tools.name: IterativeSolvers.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Iterative algorithms for solving linear systems in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing iterative algorithms for solving linear systems, eigensystems, and singular value problems, essential for scientific computing.

tools.name: Conda.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Conda environment manager integration for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package that allows managing binary dependencies using Conda, facilitating the integration of Python-based scientific tools within the Julia ecosystem.

tools.name: KrylovKit.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Krylov methods for linear problems and matrix functions
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library implementing Krylov subspace methods for solving linear problems, eigenvalues, singular values, and matrix functions in scientific computing.

tools.name: SCALE-MAMBA
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Secure Multi-Party Computation (MPC)
tools.detailed_description: A research system for Secure Multi-Party Computation, enabling privacy-preserving computation on data, often used in secure scientific data analysis.

tools.name: pytorch-aarch64
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch binaries for ARM64/AArch64 architectures
tools.detailed_description: A repository providing PyTorch wheels and Conda packages for ARMv8/AArch64, enabling AI/ML workloads on Edge devices and ARM-based HPC systems.

tools.name: uberenv
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Spack package deployment for HPC
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by LLNL to automate the use of Spack for building and deploying complex scientific software stacks and dependencies.

tools.name: PointMamba
tools.one_line_profile: State Space Model for 3D point cloud analysis
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework applying State Space Models (Mamba) to 3D point cloud analysis, applicable in geospatial and structural scientific data processing.

tools.name: PSCondaEnvs
tools.one_line_profile: PowerShell scripts for Conda environment management
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts enabling native Conda environment activation and deactivation within PowerShell, facilitating scientific workflows on Windows.

tools.name: sumo-rl
tools.one_line_profile: Reinforcement Learning environments for traffic simulation
tools.detailed_description: A library providing Reinforcement Learning environments for traffic signal control using the SUMO simulator, supporting scientific research in transportation systems.

tools.name: LUMI-EasyBuild-contrib
tools.one_line_profile: EasyBuild configurations for LUMI supercomputer
tools.detailed_description: A repository of EasyConfig files for building scientific software stacks on the LUMI supercomputer, enabling reproducible HPC environments.

tools.name: LUMI-SoftwareStack
tools.one_line_profile: Software stack setup for LUMI supercomputer
tools.detailed_description: Scripts and configurations for setting up the LMOD-based module system and EasyBuild environment on the LUMI supercomputer.

tools.name: dsatools
tools.one_line_profile: Digital signal analysis library for Python
tools.detailed_description: A library for digital signal analysis and parameter estimation, including ARMA, SSA, EMD, and other techniques for processing scientific signal data.

tools.name: VRQuestionnaireToolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for data collection in virtual environments
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit enabling the collection of subjective measures and questionnaire data within virtual environments, used for research in psychology and HCI.

tools.name: MathInspector
tools.one_line_profile: Visual programming environment for scientific computing
tools.detailed_description: A visual programming environment designed for scientific computing and mathematics visualization using Python.

tools.name: ngmo-environments
tools.one_line_profile: Environment configurations for Met Office Momentum models
tools.detailed_description: Configuration repository for setting up Next Generation Environments for Momentum, supporting meteorological and climate modeling workflows.

tools.name: AlphaFold3-Conda-Install
tools.one_line_profile: Installation scripts for AlphaFold 3 via Conda
tools.detailed_description: A repository providing scripts and guides to automate the installation and environment configuration of AlphaFold 3 using Conda, facilitating structural biology research.

tools.name: molssi-hub
tools.one_line_profile: Container Hub for Computational Molecular Science
tools.detailed_description: A central hub and registry for containers specifically designed for computational molecular science applications, maintained by MolSSI.

tools.name: facemap
tools.one_line_profile: Neural activity prediction from orofacial movements
tools.detailed_description: A framework for analyzing behavioral videos to predict neural activity from mouse orofacial movements, including SVD analysis of video data.

tools.name: LightM-UNet
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Mamba-based UNet for medical segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of LightM-UNet, a lightweight medical image segmentation model leveraging Mamba architecture for efficiency.

tools.name: Inception
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight container runtime designed for HPC environments
tools.detailed_description: Inception is a lightweight container runtime primarily targeting HPC environments. It allows unprivileged users to run containers on HPC systems, focusing on security and performance.

tools.name: Shifter
tools.one_line_profile: Container runtime for HPC environments enabling user-defined images
tools.detailed_description: Shifter is a container runtime designed for High Performance Computing (HPC) environments. It allows users to run custom Docker images on supercomputers, addressing security and performance requirements specific to shared HPC resources.

tools.name: Remote Sensing Mamba
tools.one_line_profile: State Space Model architecture tailored for remote sensing image analysis
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of Remote Sensing Mamba, a deep learning model based on the Mamba architecture, specifically optimized for processing and analyzing remote sensing imagery data.

tools.name: NVFlare
tools.one_line_profile: Federated learning runtime environment for collaborative AI model training
tools.detailed_description: NVIDIA Federated Learning Application Runtime Environment (NVFlare) is a platform that enables federated learning, allowing multiple parties to collaborate on training AI models (often used in medical imaging and scientific collaboration) without sharing raw data.

tools.name: container-canary
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for validating container images against defined requirements
tools.detailed_description: Container Canary is a tool for testing and validating container requirements against versioned manifests. It is useful in scientific workflows to ensure container images meet specific environment specifications before deployment.

tools.name: enroot
tools.one_line_profile: Simple, powerful tool to turn container images into unprivileged sandboxes for HPC
tools.detailed_description: Enroot is a tool designed to turn traditional container/OS images into unprivileged sandboxes. It is widely used in HPC environments (often with PyTorch/NVIDIA stacks) to provide a lightweight and performant container runtime.

tools.name: HPC Container Maker
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to generate Dockerfiles and Singularity definition files for HPC
tools.detailed_description: HPC Container Maker (HPCCM) is a Python tool that generates Dockerfiles and Singularity definition files. It simplifies the creation of container specifications for High Performance Computing (HPC) applications by providing high-level primitives.

tools.name: libnvidia-container
tools.one_line_profile: Library for NVIDIA GPU container runtime support
tools.detailed_description: The NVIDIA container runtime library (libnvidia-container) provides a C API to configure containers with NVIDIA GPU support. It is a foundational component for running GPU-accelerated scientific applications in containers.

tools.name: nvidia-container-runtime
tools.one_line_profile: Container runtime hook to enable NVIDIA GPU support in containers
tools.detailed_description: NVIDIA Container Runtime is a modified version of runc that adds a custom pre-start hook to enable NVIDIA GPU support. It is essential for running AI and scientific simulation workloads in Docker/Kubernetes environments.

tools.name: envkernel
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter kernel manager for Conda, Docker, Singularity, and Lmod environments
tools.detailed_description: Envkernel allows users to run Jupyter kernels inside different environments such as Conda, Virtualenv, Docker, Singularity, and Lmod. It bridges interactive scientific computing (Jupyter) with HPC environment management systems.

tools.name: hatch-conda
tools.one_line_profile: Hatch plugin to manage Conda environments
tools.detailed_description: Hatch-conda is a plugin for the Hatch project manager that enables the use of Conda environments. Since Conda is the de facto standard for scientific software packaging, this tool facilitates scientific Python development workflows.

tools.name: pixi-pack
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to pack and unpack Conda environments created with pixi
tools.detailed_description: Pixi-pack is a utility for packing and unpacking Conda environments created with the 'pixi' package manager. It aids in the reproducibility and distribution of scientific computing environments.

tools.name: neurodocker
tools.one_line_profile: Generator for custom Docker and Singularity images for neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: Neurodocker is a command-line tool that generates custom Dockerfiles and Singularity definition files for neuroimaging and scientific computing. It simplifies the creation of reproducible environments containing common neuroscience software (FSL, SPM, etc.).

tools.name: Spackenv
tools.one_line_profile: Environment management wrapper for Spack in HPC clusters
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by SJTU HPC to manage and switch between Spack environments, facilitating software management for sysadmins, users, and developers in high-performance computing contexts.

tools.name: Create-A-Container
tools.one_line_profile: Builder for custom Singularity/Apptainer HPC containers
tools.detailed_description: A repository and toolset for building custom Singularity/Apptainer containers tailored for specific HPC environments (RAP Workstation, CREATE HPC), supporting reproducible scientific workflows.

tools.name: Singular
tools.one_line_profile: Computer algebra system for polynomial computations
tools.detailed_description: A computer algebra system for polynomial computations, with special emphasis on commutative and non-commutative algebra, algebraic geometry, and singularity theory.

tools.name: SkyText-Chinese-GPT3
tools.one_line_profile: Chinese GPT-3 pre-trained large language model
tools.detailed_description: A Chinese GPT-3 pre-trained large model capable of text generation, dialogue, translation, and reasoning, serving as a foundation model for NLP research.

tools.name: StaPH-B Docker Builds
tools.one_line_profile: Container recipes for public health bioinformatics
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Dockerfiles and documentation providing reproducible container environments for public health bioinformatics tools and workflows.

tools.name: BeeGFS CSI Driver
tools.one_line_profile: Kubernetes CSI driver for BeeGFS parallel file system
tools.detailed_description: A Container Storage Interface (CSI) driver that enables Kubernetes clusters to utilize BeeGFS, a high-performance parallel file system commonly used in HPC environments.

tools.name: skrl
tools.one_line_profile: Modular Reinforcement Learning library for robotics and physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: A modular Reinforcement Learning library built on PyTorch, JAX, and NVIDIA Warp, designed to support scientific environments like Isaac Lab, Brax, and Gymnasium for robotics and physics control tasks.

tools.name: AkôFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Middleware for container-based scientific workflows
tools.detailed_description: An open-source middleware for orchestrating and executing container-based scientific workflows across heterogeneous environments, developed for e-Science applications.

tools.name: E4S Spack Environments
tools.one_line_profile: Spack environments and container recipes for E4S
tools.detailed_description: Configuration files and recipes for creating Spack environments and containers for the Extreme-scale Scientific Software Stack (E4S), facilitating reproducible HPC software deployment.

tools.name: MogaNet
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Multi-order Gated Aggregation Network for vision tasks
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of MogaNet, a neural network architecture for efficient computer vision tasks, serving as a tool for image analysis and feature extraction.

tools.name: MedMamba
tools.one_line_profile: Vision Mamba model for medical image classification
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model applying the Mamba architecture to medical image classification tasks, providing a tool for medical image analysis.

tools.name: NavRL
tools.one_line_profile: Reinforcement learning framework for safe flight navigation
tools.detailed_description: A reinforcement learning framework and library for training safe flight navigation agents in dynamic environments, integrating with ROS and NVIDIA Isaac.

tools.name: BlackMamba
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of the BlackMamba state-space model
tools.detailed_description: Code repository for the BlackMamba architecture, a state-space model for sequence modeling, serving as a tool for AI research.

tools.name: PSSA
tools.one_line_profile: Singular Spectrum Analysis library for time series forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Singular Spectrum Analysis (SSA) for time series decomposition and forecasting, useful in scientific data analysis.

tools.name: ScienceWorld
tools.one_line_profile: Text-based virtual environment for scientific discovery agents
tools.detailed_description: A simulation environment centered around elementary science curriculum tasks to test and evaluate AI agents' reasoning and scientific problem-solving capabilities.

tools.name: DiscoveryWorld
tools.one_line_profile: Virtual environment for automated scientific discovery agents
tools.detailed_description: A virtual environment designed for developing and evaluating automated agents capable of performing scientific discovery tasks.

tools.name: conda-merge
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to merge Conda environment files
tools.detailed_description: A tool to merge multiple Conda environment specification files into a single file, facilitating complex scientific environment management.

tools.name: nb_conda
tools.one_line_profile: Conda environment management extension for Jupyter
tools.detailed_description: An extension that allows management of Conda environments and packages directly from within the Jupyter Notebook interface.

tools.name: nb_conda_kernels
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter extension for Conda environment kernels
tools.detailed_description: A package that automatically creates Jupyter kernels for all environments found in the Conda installation, enabling easy switching between scientific environments.

tools.name: Apptainer
tools.one_line_profile: Container system for High Performance Computing (HPC)
tools.detailed_description: The open-source container system (formerly Singularity) designed for HPC environments, allowing researchers to package and run applications reproducibly.

tools.name: Singularity
tools.one_line_profile: Container platform for HPC (Legacy/Snapshot)
tools.detailed_description: The legacy repository for Singularity (now Apptainer), a container platform optimized for High Performance Computing and scientific workflows.

tools.name: uv
tools.one_line_profile: Extremely fast Python package and project manager
tools.detailed_description: A modern, high-performance Python package manager that serves as a drop-in replacement for pip and pip-tools, increasingly used in scientific Python ecosystems for environment reproducibility.

tools.name: uvify
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to convert Python repos to uv environments
tools.detailed_description: A utility to automatically generate `uv` environment configurations from existing Python repositories, facilitating reproducible scientific environments.

tools.name: DockerMake
tools.one_line_profile: Reproducible Docker image build system for complex stacks
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool to build and manage Docker images for complex software stacks, designed to support reproducible research and scientific workflows.

tools.name: TwinGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed container orchestration framework for simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for orchestrating distributed containerized applications, specifically targeting high-throughput simulations, digital twins, and scientific optimization tasks on AWS/K8s.

tools.name: Bactopia
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for complete analysis of bacterial genomes
tools.detailed_description: A flexible and comprehensive Nextflow pipeline for the analysis of bacterial genomes, including QC, assembly, and annotation.

tools.name: unidep
tools.one_line_profile: Unified dependency management for pip and conda
tools.detailed_description: A tool that provides a single source of truth for Python requirements, handling both pip and conda dependencies to simplify scientific environment setup.

tools.name: pybullet-gym
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source OpenAI Gym MuJoCo environments using PyBullet
tools.detailed_description: A reimplementation of OpenAI Gym MuJoCo environments using the open-source PyBullet physics engine, enabling reinforcement learning research without proprietary licenses.

tools.name: Master of Pores
tools.one_line_profile: Nextflow pipeline for direct RNA Nanopore sequencing analysis
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics pipeline built with Nextflow for processing and analyzing direct RNA sequencing data from Oxford Nanopore technologies, handling preprocessing, alignment, and modification detection.

tools.name: Graph-Mamba
tools.one_line_profile: Long-range graph sequence modelling with selective state spaces
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model integrating Mamba's selective state space models with graph neural networks to capture long-range dependencies in graph sequences, applicable to molecular and structural analysis.

tools.name: U-Mamba
tools.one_line_profile: CNN-Mamba hybrid network for biomedical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose biomedical image segmentation tool that enhances long-range dependency modeling by combining State Space Models (Mamba) with CNN-based U-Net architectures.

tools.name: irlba
tools.one_line_profile: Fast truncated singular value decomposition (SVD) library
tools.detailed_description: An R library for implicitly restarted Lanczos bidiagonalization algorithms, providing fast truncated SVD and PCA for large sparse or dense matrices common in scientific data analysis.

tools.name: calkit
tools.one_line_profile: Project management tool for reproducible research
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool and Python library designed to simplify version control, environment management, and reproducible pipelines specifically for research projects.

tools.name: cmcrameri
tools.one_line_profile: Perceptually uniform colourmaps for geosciences
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing Fabio Crameri's perceptually uniform colourmaps, designed to accurately represent scientific data in geosciences and prevent visual distortion.

tools.name: conda-auto-env
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Conda environment activator
tools.detailed_description: A shell utility that automatically activates the appropriate Conda environment when entering a directory containing an environment.yml file, streamlining scientific workflows.

tools.name: vim-conda
tools.one_line_profile: Vim plugin for Conda environment switching
tools.detailed_description: A Vim plugin that allows users to change Conda environments directly within the editor, facilitating development in scientific Python environments.

tools.name: CompareM2
tools.one_line_profile: Microbial genomes-to-report pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive pipeline for comparative genomics of microbial isolates, automating the process from genomes to analytical reports.

tools.name: detectron2-windows
tools.one_line_profile: Windows build of Detectron2
tools.detailed_description: A distribution of Facebook AI Research's Detectron2 library optimized for Windows, enabling object detection and segmentation research on Windows platforms.

tools.name: conda-env
tools.one_line_profile: Interface for managing Conda environments
tools.detailed_description: A tool for managing Conda environments, allowing users to create, export, list, remove, and update environments, essential for reproducible scientific computing.

tools.name: conda-smithy
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for managing conda-forge feedstocks
tools.detailed_description: A tool used to manage the conda-forge scientific software distribution ecosystem, automating the linting, re-rendering, and updating of feedstock repositories.

tools.name: Miniforge
tools.one_line_profile: Minimal installer for Conda specific to conda-forge
tools.detailed_description: A minimal installer for Conda that is pre-configured to use the conda-forge channel, widely used in the scientific community for setting up Python/R environments, especially on architectures like Apple Silicon (M1/M2) and AArch64.

tools.name: conda-docker
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to create minimal docker images from conda environments
tools.detailed_description: A tool that allows users to generate Docker images directly from Conda environments without requiring a Docker daemon, facilitating the containerization of scientific workflows.

tools.name: conda-env-builder
tools.one_line_profile: Builder for maintaining multiple custom conda environments
tools.detailed_description: A tool to build and maintain multiple custom Conda environments from a single configuration source, useful for managing complex scientific software stacks.

tools.name: conda-project
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for encapsulating and reproducing projects with Conda
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to encapsulate, run, and reproduce data science projects by managing Conda environments and project-specific commands.

tools.name: conda-store
tools.one_line_profile: Server for managing and serving Conda environments
tools.detailed_description: A tool that provides a way to build and serve Conda environments for data science teams, often integrated with JupyterHub to ensure consistent environments across users.

tools.name: conda-tree
tools.one_line_profile: Dependency tree analyzer for Conda environments
tools.detailed_description: A utility to inspect the dependency tree of Conda environments, helping scientists debug package conflicts and understand environment structure.

tools.name: condacolab
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to install Conda on Google Colab
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that enables the installation and use of Conda/Mamba on Google Colab, allowing researchers to use scientific packages not available in the default Colab runtime.

tools.name: conda-execute
tools.one_line_profile: Execute scripts in temporary Conda environments
tools.detailed_description: A tool to execute scripts in their own temporary, reproducible Conda environments defined within the script itself, ensuring consistent execution contexts.

tools.name: Conda
tools.one_line_profile: Package, dependency and environment management for any language
tools.detailed_description: The de facto standard package and environment manager for scientific computing (Python, R, etc.), enabling users to install, run, and update packages and their dependencies.

tools.name: conda-build
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for building conda packages
tools.detailed_description: The build system for creating Conda packages, essential for packaging scientific software for distribution via channels like conda-forge.

tools.name: conda-libmamba-solver
tools.one_line_profile: Fast libmamba-based solver for Conda
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Conda that uses the libmamba solver to significantly speed up dependency resolution in complex scientific environments.

tools.name: conda-lock
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight lockfile generator for Conda
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate fully reproducible lockfiles for Conda environments across multiple platforms, ensuring identical environments for scientific collaboration.

tools.name: conda-pack
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to package conda environments for redistribution
tools.detailed_description: A tool for creating relocatable archives of Conda environments, widely used to deploy scientific environments to Spark/Hadoop clusters or HPC nodes where Conda is not installed.

tools.name: constructor
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating installers from conda packages
tools.detailed_description: A tool that allows users to create custom installers (like Miniconda or Anaconda) from a collection of Conda packages, used for distributing scientific software stacks.

tools.name: Grayskull
tools.one_line_profile: Recipe generator for Conda packages
tools.detailed_description: An automatic recipe generator for Conda that creates recipes for PyPI packages, simplifying the process of adding scientific Python libraries to conda-forge.

tools.name: rattler
tools.one_line_profile: Rust crates for the Conda ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Rust library and toolkit for working with the Conda ecosystem, providing the foundation for next-generation Conda tools (like pixi).

tools.name: Buildah
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for building OCI images, often used in HPC
tools.detailed_description: A tool that facilitates building OCI container images. It is particularly important in scientific HPC environments for its ability to build containers without root privileges (rootless).

tools.name: Podman
tools.one_line_profile: Daemonless container engine for OCI containers
tools.detailed_description: A daemonless container engine for developing, managing, and running OCI containers. It is the standard for running containers in HPC environments due to its rootless capabilities and compatibility with Docker CLI.

tools.name: podman-compose
tools.one_line_profile: Run docker-compose.yml using Podman
tools.detailed_description: A script that allows users to run docker-compose.yml files using Podman, enabling the orchestration of multi-container scientific workflows in rootless environments.

tools.name: podman-py
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for Podman
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for interacting with the Podman REST API, allowing scientific applications to programmatically manage containers.

tools.name: podman-tui
tools.one_line_profile: Terminal UI for Podman
tools.detailed_description: A terminal user interface for Podman, facilitating the management of containers and pods in terminal-only environments common in HPC and remote servers.

tools.name: RamaLama
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for local serving of AI models via containers
tools.detailed_description: An open-source tool that simplifies the local serving and inference of AI models using containers, abstracting the complexity of hardware acceleration and container runtimes.

tools.name: mrs_apptainer
tools.one_line_profile: Apptainer wrappers and resources for the MRS UAV System
tools.detailed_description: Provides Apptainer (Singularity) wrappers, definitions, and scripts specifically designed for the MRS UAV System, facilitating reproducible robotics research environments and workflows.

tools.name: ck-docker
tools.one_line_profile: Collective Knowledge extension for Docker automation
tools.detailed_description: Extension for the Collective Knowledge (CK) framework to automate Docker build, run, and push functions, enabling collaborative and reproducible research workflows and artifact management.

tools.name: Omnia Artifactory
tools.one_line_profile: HPC cluster container management and automation tools
tools.detailed_description: Part of the Omnia framework, providing tools to build, manage, and deploy containerized services for HPC clusters, including Ansible-based provisioning and automated image creation.

tools.name: Phobos
tools.one_line_profile: Blender add-on for robot model creation (URDF/SDF)
tools.detailed_description: An add-on for Blender that enables the creation and editing of URDF, SDF, and SMURF robot models in a WYSIWYG environment for robotics simulation and research.

tools.name: wfl
tools.one_line_profile: Simple job workflow library for Go supporting HPC/Containers
tools.detailed_description: A Go library for creating job workflows that can run in processes, containers, pods, or HPC jobs (supporting DRMAA), facilitating scientific workflow management.

tools.name: neuron_poker
tools.one_line_profile: Texas Hold'em RL environment
tools.detailed_description: A reinforcement learning environment for Texas Hold'em poker, based on keras-rl, used for AI research in game theory and decision making.

tools.name: poetry2conda
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to convert Poetry projects to Conda environments
tools.detailed_description: A utility that converts Python pyproject.toml configuration files into Conda environment.yaml files, bridging standard Python packaging with the scientific Conda ecosystem.

tools.name: earth-analytics-python-env
tools.one_line_profile: Conda environment and Docker container for Earth and environmental science
tools.detailed_description: A pre-configured Conda environment and Docker container designed to support Python-based workflows in earth and environmental data science. It ensures reproducibility by providing a consistent set of libraries for geospatial analysis and data processing.

tools.name: JSC EasyBuild Repository
tools.one_line_profile: Jülich Supercomputing Centre's EasyBuild configuration repository
tools.detailed_description: The public repository of EasyBuild configuration files (easyconfigs) and custom blocks used by the Jülich Supercomputing Centre (JSC). It enables the reproduction of the scientific software stack deployed on JSC's HPC systems.

tools.name: EasyBuild
tools.one_line_profile: Software build and installation framework for HPC systems
tools.detailed_description: A software installation framework written in Python that allows for the structured, robust, and reproducible building of scientific software stacks on High Performance Computing (HPC) systems. It automates the compilation and management of dependencies.

tools.name: easybuild-easyblocks
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of Python modules for EasyBuild software installation logic
tools.detailed_description: A collection of 'easyblocks' that implement the specific build and installation logic for various scientific software packages within the EasyBuild framework. These blocks define how to configure, build, and install complex scientific applications.

tools.name: easybuild-easyconfigs
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of build configuration files for EasyBuild
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive collection of 'easyconfig' files that describe which scientific software versions to build, using which toolchains and dependencies. It serves as the central database of recipes for the EasyBuild ecosystem.

tools.name: easybuild-framework
tools.one_line_profile: Core framework for the EasyBuild software installation system
tools.detailed_description: The core Python framework of EasyBuild that provides the functionality to parse easyconfigs, load easyblocks, and execute the build and installation process for scientific software on HPC infrastructure.

tools.name: eb-singularity
tools.one_line_profile: Integration tools for EasyBuild and Singularity containers
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools and scripts to integrate EasyBuild with Singularity (Apptainer), enabling the generation of scientific containers directly from EasyBuild recipes for reproducible HPC workflows.

tools.name: OpenArm
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source humanoid arm for physical AI research
tools.detailed_description: A low-cost, open-source robotic arm platform designed for research in physical AI, teleoperation, and contact-rich manipulation. It provides the hardware design and software interfaces necessary for training and testing embodied AI agents.

tools.name: EPFL-SCITAS Spack Config
tools.one_line_profile: Spack configuration for EPFL SCITAS HPC deployment
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing site-specific configurations, package lists, and helper scripts for deploying the Spack package manager at the EPFL SCITAS supercomputing facility. It facilitates the reproducible deployment of scientific software in that specific HPC environment.

tools.name: svd3
tools.one_line_profile: Fast 3x3 singular value decomposition library
tools.detailed_description: A specialized library for performing fast singular value decomposition (SVD), diagonalization, and QR decomposition of 3x3 matrices. This is a critical low-level kernel for many physics simulations, computer graphics, and mechanics problems.

tools.name: CSCS Production Scripts
tools.one_line_profile: User scripts and tools for CSCS HPC environment
tools.detailed_description: A collection of utility scripts and tools for users of the Swiss National Supercomputing Centre (CSCS). It includes helpers for job submission, environment setup, and data management specific to CSCS scientific infrastructure.

tools.name: py2spack
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from Python packages to Spack recipes
tools.detailed_description: A tool that automates the conversion of standard Python packages (from PyPI) into Spack package recipes. It simplifies the process of adding new Python scientific libraries to the Spack ecosystem.

tools.name: Sarus
tools.one_line_profile: OCI-compatible container engine for HPC environments
tools.detailed_description: A container engine designed specifically for High Performance Computing (HPC) environments. It provides OCI compliance while addressing the unique security and performance requirements of HPC, such as support for MPI, GPU, and high-speed interconnects.

tools.name: spack-batteries-included
tools.one_line_profile: Standalone Spack installer
tools.detailed_description: A project aimed at installing the Spack package manager without relying on system dependencies, ensuring a self-contained and portable package management setup for scientific computing environments.

tools.name: Habitat-Lab
tools.one_line_profile: Modular library for training embodied AI agents
tools.detailed_description: A modular high-level library designed to train embodied AI agents across a variety of tasks (like navigation and instruction following) and 3D environments. It serves as a standard platform for simulation-based AI research.

tools.name: fastai-docker-containers
tools.one_line_profile: Docker images for the fastai deep learning library
tools.detailed_description: Official Docker containers for the fastai library, providing a reproducible and pre-configured environment for deep learning research and development. It simplifies the setup of GPU-accelerated AI workflows.

tools.name: easybuild.experimental
tools.one_line_profile: Experimental contributions for EasyBuild
tools.detailed_description: A repository for experimental or community-contributed EasyBuild configurations and blocks that are not yet part of the main stable release. It serves as a staging ground for new scientific software recipes.

tools.name: easy_update
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to update EasyBuild configuration files
tools.detailed_description: A utility script to automate the updating of EasyBuild easyconfig files, specifically for R and Python bundles. It helps maintainers keep scientific software stacks up to date with minimal manual effort.

tools.name: nixpack
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of Nix and Spack package managers
tools.detailed_description: An experimental tool from the Flatiron Institute that aims to combine the strengths of the Nix package manager (reproducibility) and Spack (HPC optimization) for scientific software deployment.

tools.name: copip
tools.one_line_profile: Environment development overlays for Conda to facilitate reproducible scientific workflows
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to manage development overlays for Conda environments, allowing users to install packages in 'development mode' (editable installs) on top of existing Conda environments. This is particularly useful in scientific computing workflows where researchers need to modify libraries without breaking the base reproducible environment.

tools.name: SegMamba
tools.one_line_profile: Long-range sequential modeling Mamba for 3D medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model based on the Mamba architecture designed for 3D medical image segmentation. It addresses the challenge of modeling long-range dependencies in volumetric medical data, providing a tool for scientific analysis of medical imaging datasets.

tools.name: Popper
tools.one_line_profile: Container-native task automation engine for scientific reproducibility
tools.detailed_description: A tool for defining and executing container-native workflows, specifically designed to implement the 'Popper Convention' for scientific reproducibility. It allows researchers to automate experiments and validate results in a portable way using containers (Docker, Singularity).

tools.name: GitLab HPC CI/CB
tools.one_line_profile: GitLab runner scripts for HPC systems using Enroot and Slurm
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools and scripts to enable Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Benchmarking (CB) on High Performance Computing (HPC) systems. It leverages Slurm for job scheduling and Enroot for containerization, facilitating automated testing of scientific software in HPC environments.

tools.name: docker-centos7-slurm
tools.one_line_profile: Slurm Docker container for simulating HPC clusters
tools.detailed_description: A Docker container setup that runs Slurm on CentOS 7, providing a simulated HPC environment. This tool is used by researchers and developers to develop and test HPC workflows and job submission scripts locally before deploying to actual supercomputers.

tools.name: HOOMD-blue
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics and Monte Carlo soft matter simulation on GPUs
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose particle simulation toolkit optimized for GPUs. It performs molecular dynamics (MD) and Monte Carlo (MC) simulations of soft matter systems, widely used in physics, chemistry, and materials science research.

tools.name: PyBOMBS
tools.one_line_profile: Package management system for GNU Radio and scientific signal processing
tools.detailed_description: The GNU Radio install management system (Python Build Overlay Managed Bundle System). It resolves dependencies and installs out-of-tree projects for GNU Radio, a key framework in scientific signal processing and radio astronomy.

tools.name: OpenSpiel
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for reinforcement learning and search in games
tools.detailed_description: A collection of environments and algorithms for research in general reinforcement learning and search/planning in games. It serves as a platform for scientific research in AI, game theory, and multi-agent systems.

tools.name: containerize-conda
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to convert Conda environments into Singularity containers
tools.detailed_description: A utility that packages an existing Conda environment into a Singularity container (or a squashfs image). This bridges the gap between scientific package management (Conda) and HPC container runtimes (Singularity), ensuring reproducibility on supercomputers.

tools.name: rstudio-server-conda
tools.one_line_profile: Deployment tool for RStudio Server within Conda environments
tools.detailed_description: A wrapper script and configuration to run RStudio Server inside a Conda environment. This allows data scientists to manage R versions and dependencies via Conda while using the standard RStudio IDE interface, facilitating reproducible data analysis environments.

tools.name: MCC
tools.one_line_profile: Automated container cluster creation tool for scientific computing
tools.detailed_description: My Container Cluster (MCC) is a tool developed by the GRyCAP research group to automate the creation of container-based computing clusters (using LXD). It is designed to support scientific computing workloads on cloud infrastructures.

tools.name: Cobra
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-modal Large Language Model extending Mamba for efficient inference
tools.detailed_description: A Multi-modal Large Language Model (MLLM) that extends the Mamba architecture. It is designed for efficient inference in multi-modal tasks, serving as a scientific AI model for processing and analyzing multi-modal data.

tools.name: PDC (Proactive Data Containers)
tools.one_line_profile: Object-centric data management system for HPC environments
tools.detailed_description: Proactive Data Containers (PDC) is a runtime system and API designed for high-performance computing (HPC) environments. It provides object-centric data management services, allowing efficient data placement in memory/storage hierarchies, asynchronous data movement, and scalable metadata operations for scientific applications.

tools.name: Project AirSim
tools.one_line_profile: High-fidelity simulation platform for autonomous systems
tools.detailed_description: Project AirSim is an advanced simulation platform designed for building, training, and testing autonomous systems (such as drones and robots) in realistic virtual environments. It supports physics-based simulation for generating synthetic scientific data for robotics and AI research.

tools.name: udocker
tools.one_line_profile: User-space container execution tool for HPC systems
tools.detailed_description: udocker is a basic user tool to execute simple Docker containers in batch or interactive systems without root privileges. It is specifically designed for High Performance Computing (HPC) environments where users lack administrative rights, enabling the use of containerized scientific applications.

tools.name: NVIDIA Isaac Sim
tools.one_line_profile: Robotics simulation and synthetic data generation platform
tools.detailed_description: NVIDIA Isaac Sim is a simulation platform built on NVIDIA Omniverse for developing, testing, and managing AI-based robots. It provides photorealistic, physically accurate virtual environments for scientific simulation and synthetic data generation in robotics research.

tools.name: conda-minify
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for minifying Conda environment specifications
tools.detailed_description: A library and tool to create minified or relaxed versions of Conda environment specifications. It facilitates the sharing and reproduction of scientific computing environments across different platforms by reducing strict dependency pinning issues.

tools.name: Berryconda
tools.one_line_profile: Conda distribution for Raspberry Pi (ARM)
tools.detailed_description: Berryconda is a Conda-based Python distribution specifically for the Raspberry Pi. It enables the management of scientific Python stacks (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, etc.) on ARM-based edge devices, facilitating scientific computing and data collection in IoT/edge scenarios.

tools.name: apptainer-in-docker
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to run Apptainer (Singularity) within Docker containers for CI/CD workflows
tools.detailed_description: A specialized container image and utility that enables running Apptainer (formerly Singularity), the standard container runtime for High Performance Computing (HPC), inside Docker environments. This is crucial for building and testing scientific containers in standard CI/CD pipelines.

tools.name: pymssa
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of Multivariate Singular Spectrum Analysis (MSSA)
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Multivariate Singular Spectrum Analysis (MSSA), a statistical technique used for time series analysis, decomposition, and forecasting in scientific domains such as geophysics and climate science.

tools.name: Mycodo
tools.one_line_profile: Environmental monitoring and regulation system for research and automation
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software system for environmental monitoring and regulation, designed to run on the Raspberry Pi. It is widely used in scientific research for lab automation, hydroponics, and biological experiments requiring precise control of environmental conditions.

tools.name: MultiModalMamba
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of Multi-Modal Mamba model for AI research
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of a Multi-Modal Model fusing Vision Transformer (ViT) with Mamba (State Space Model). It serves as a research tool for exploring efficient multi-modal representation learning.

tools.name: VisionMamba
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of Vision Mamba for efficient visual representation learning
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of the Vision Mamba architecture, offering a more efficient alternative to Transformers for visual representation learning tasks in AI research.

tools.name: Backend.AI
tools.one_line_profile: Container-based computing cluster platform for AI and HPC
tools.detailed_description: A streamlined, container-based computing cluster platform designed to host machine learning frameworks and support heterogeneous accelerators (CUDA, ROCm, TPU, IPU). It manages resources and environments for scientific computing and AI training/inference.

tools.name: libigl-python-bindings
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for the libigl geometry processing library
tools.detailed_description: Provides Python access to libigl, a simple C++ geometry processing library. It is widely used in computer graphics and scientific modeling for tasks such as meshing, parameterization, and geometric analysis.

tools.name: venvstacks
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating portable Python virtual environment stacks
tools.detailed_description: A utility to create layered, portable Python virtual environments. This is particularly useful for scientific workflows requiring reproducible environments that can be distributed across different machines or containers without full containerization overhead.

tools.name: Crocoddyl
tools.one_line_profile: Optimal control library for robot control and physics simulation
tools.detailed_description: Crocoddyl (Contact RObot COntrol by Differential DYnamic Library) is an optimal control library for robot control under contact sequence. It uses efficient Differential Dynamic Programming (DDP) algorithms for multi-body dynamics and physics simulations.

tools.name: Agent Studio
tools.one_line_profile: Environment and benchmark platform for general virtual agents
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive platform providing environments, tools, and benchmarks for evaluating general virtual agents. It supports multimodal interactions and is used for AI research in agent behavior and task completion.

tools.name: boa
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Conda package builder using Mamba
tools.detailed_description: A package builder for the Conda ecosystem that utilizes Mamba for dependency resolution. It significantly speeds up the creation of scientific packages compared to traditional Conda build tools.

tools.name: gator
tools.one_line_profile: Conda environment management extension for Jupyter
tools.detailed_description: A JupyterLab extension that provides a graphical interface for managing Conda/Mamba environments and packages directly within the scientific notebook interface.

tools.name: Mamba
tools.one_line_profile: Fast, cross-platform package manager for scientific computing
tools.detailed_description: A reimplementation of the Conda package manager in C++. It offers parallel downloading of repository data and package files, and much faster dependency solving, serving as a critical infrastructure tool for scientific Python environments.

tools.name: micromamba-docker
tools.one_line_profile: Docker utilities for Micromamba-based scientific containers
tools.detailed_description: Provides base images and utilities for building lightweight Docker containers using Micromamba. It is essential for creating reproducible and efficient containerized scientific environments.

tools.name: Quetz
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source server for Conda package repositories
tools.detailed_description: A server implementation for hosting Conda packages. It allows scientific organizations to manage their own package channels and artifacts, supporting the distribution of scientific software.

tools.name: vscode-micromamba
tools.one_line_profile: VS Code extension for Micromamba environments
tools.detailed_description: Integrates Micromamba into Visual Studio Code, allowing researchers and developers to easily create, activate, and manage scientific Python environments directly from their editor.

tools.name: Sublime Text Conda
tools.one_line_profile: Conda environment management for Sublime Text
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Sublime Text 3 that enables users to work with Conda environments, including activation, deactivation, and package management, facilitating scientific development workflows.

tools.name: condax
tools.one_line_profile: Isolated execution of Conda-packaged applications
tools.detailed_description: A tool similar to pipx but for Conda. It allows users to install and run scientific applications packaged with Conda in isolated environments, preventing dependency conflicts.

tools.name: conda-move
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to relocate Conda environments
tools.detailed_description: A shell script utility to move Conda environments from one directory to another, handling the necessary path updates. Useful for reorganizing scientific computing environments.

tools.name: Syndeo
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for running massively parallel Ray jobs on SLURM with Apptainer
tools.detailed_description: Syndeo bridges modern AI frameworks (Ray) with traditional scientific HPC schedulers (SLURM) using secure containerization (Apptainer), enabling scalable AI4S workflows.

tools.name: MLRun
tools.one_line_profile: Open source MLOps platform for managing continuous ML applications
tools.detailed_description: MLRun provides an open MLOps orchestration framework to manage the lifecycle of machine learning applications, including data preparation, training, and deployment, facilitating reproducibility in data science.

tools.name: repo2apptainer
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper to convert repo2docker environments into Apptainer images for HPC
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by NCAR to facilitate reproducible science by converting Jupyter-ready repositories (repo2docker format) into Apptainer/Singularity images compatible with High Performance Computing environments.

tools.name: Nextflow
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow orchestration engine for data-driven computational pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A domain-specific language and runtime environment for creating scalable, portable, and reproducible scientific workflows, widely adopted in bioinformatics and data-intensive science.

tools.name: Nextstrain CLI
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for running and visualizing pathogen evolution analysis
tools.detailed_description: The command-line interface for Nextstrain, enabling consistent execution of pathogen build pipelines and visualization (Augur/Auspice) across different computing environments (Docker, Conda, AWS Batch).

tools.name: Sarek
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis pipeline for germline and somatic variant calling
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Nextflow pipeline for detecting germline or somatic variants from Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) or targeted sequencing data, handling pre-processing, variant calling, and annotation.

tools.name: PyGame Learning Environment (PLE)
tools.one_line_profile: Reinforcement learning environment based on PyGame
tools.detailed_description: A framework that provides a learning environment for Reinforcement Learning agents using PyGame, allowing the simulation of games for AI training and evaluation.

tools.name: conda-depgraph
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for Conda environment dependencies
tools.detailed_description: A command-line utility designed to generate and plot the dependency graph of a Conda environment, aiding in the management and debugging of complex scientific software environments.

tools.name: Open-CE
tools.one_line_profile: Build recipes and environment definitions for AI/HPC packages
tools.detailed_description: A community-driven project providing recipes and tools to build and distribute Python and binary packages for the Open Cognitive Environment, focusing on AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning frameworks on HPC architectures.

tools.name: leafmap
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive geospatial analysis and mapping library
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for interactive mapping and geospatial analysis with minimal coding in a Jupyter environment, supporting various mapping backends and data formats for scientific geospatial research.

tools.name: poetry-kernel
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter kernel for Poetry-managed environments
tools.detailed_description: A tool that creates a Jupyter kernel for Python projects managed by Poetry, facilitating reproducible scientific computing workflows within Jupyter notebooks.

tools.name: PLIP
tools.one_line_profile: Protein-Ligand Interaction Profiler
tools.detailed_description: A tool to analyze and visualize non-covalent protein-ligand interactions in PDB files, widely used in structural biology and drug discovery.

tools.name: Archiconda3
tools.one_line_profile: Conda distribution for ARM64 devices
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Anaconda environment distribution specifically designed for ARM64 devices (like Raspberry Pi, Jetson), enabling scientific computing stacks on edge hardware.

tools.name: pixi
tools.one_line_profile: Package management tool for reproducible scientific environments based on the Conda ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: Pixi is a package manager built on top of the Conda ecosystem that focuses on project-local environments and reproducibility. It allows developers and scientists to manage dependencies and environments declaratively, ensuring consistent execution across different machines, which is critical for scientific reproducibility.

tools.name: rattler-build
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance builder for Conda packages
tools.detailed_description: rattler-build is a universal and fast tool for building Conda packages. It serves as a modern replacement for conda-build, enabling the creation of binary artifacts for scientific software across multiple platforms, which is essential for the distribution of AI4S tools.

tools.name: PRIMME
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance library for solving large sparse eigenvalue and singular value problems
tools.detailed_description: PRIMME (PReconditioned Iterative MultiMethod Eigensolver) is a high-performance library for computing a few eigenvalues/eigenvectors and singular values/vectors of large, sparse matrices. It is widely used in scientific computing applications such as quantum physics, chemistry, and structural mechanics.

tools.name: Bender
tools.one_line_profile: Dependency management tool for hardware design and verification projects
tools.detailed_description: Bender is a dependency management tool specifically designed for hardware description languages (SystemVerilog, VHDL). It manages IP cores and verification components, facilitating reproducible hardware design workflows in research and engineering (e.g., RISC-V research).

tools.name: PyAMG
tools.one_line_profile: Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers for large sparse linear systems
tools.detailed_description: PyAMG is a library of Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers for solving large sparse linear systems of equations. It provides implementations of Ruge-Stuben (RS) and Smoothed Aggregation (SA) AMG, commonly used in scientific simulations involving partial differential equations.

tools.name: PyMTL3
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based framework for hardware generation, simulation, and verification
tools.detailed_description: PyMTL3 is a framework for multi-level hardware modeling. It allows researchers to design, simulate, and verify hardware components using Python, bridging the gap between high-level modeling and low-level RTL implementation.

tools.name: Prosodic
tools.one_line_profile: Metrical-phonological parser for linguistic analysis
tools.detailed_description: Prosodic is a scientific tool for the analysis of language prosody. It parses text to determine its metrical structure, useful in linguistics and digital humanities research for analyzing poetry, speech rhythm, and phonology.

tools.name: FireHPC
tools.one_line_profile: Container-based HPC cluster emulator for workflow testing
tools.detailed_description: FireHPC is a tool designed to instantly emulate an HPC cluster using containers. It allows researchers and system administrators to test HPC workflows, schedulers, and configurations in a reproducible local environment without needing access to a physical supercomputer.

tools.name: radioconda-installer
tools.one_line_profile: Software radio distribution and environment manager based on Conda
tools.detailed_description: Radioconda is a distribution of software-defined radio (SDR) tools packaged with Conda. This installer sets up a reproducible environment containing essential tools for radio science and signal processing research, such as GNU Radio and various hardware drivers.

tools.name: OpenRAVE
tools.one_line_profile: Environment for testing and developing robotics motion planning algorithms
tools.detailed_description: OpenRAVE (Open Robotics Automation Virtual Environment) is a platform for robotics research. It provides an environment for testing, developing, and deploying motion planning algorithms, focusing on simulation and analysis of kinematic and geometric constraints.

tools.name: poetry-conda
tools.one_line_profile: Poetry plugin for managing Conda environments
tools.detailed_description: This tool is a plugin for Poetry that enables the creation and management of Conda environments directly from Poetry workflows. It bridges the gap between the standard Python packaging ecosystem (Poetry) and the scientific computing ecosystem (Conda), facilitating reproducible research environments.

tools.name: What the Phage
tools.one_line_profile: Reproducible pipeline for phage identification and annotation
tools.detailed_description: What the Phage (WtP) is a bioinformatics pipeline for the identification and annotation of bacteriophages. It leverages Nextflow and containers (Docker/Singularity) to ensure reproducibility and scalability across different computing environments.

tools.name: allgebra
tools.one_line_profile: Base container environment for C++ and Fortran HPC application development
tools.detailed_description: A specialized Docker container image designed to provide a reproducible build and runtime environment for High Performance Computing (HPC) applications written in C++ and Fortran. It serves as a foundational layer for scientific software development, ensuring consistency across different computing clusters.

tools.name: law
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale task workflow management system for High Energy Physics
tools.detailed_description: A workflow management system based on Luigi, designed for large-scale physics analysis (specifically High Energy Physics). It extends Luigi with features for remote job submission (HTCondor, Slurm, etc.), remote file targets, and environment sandboxing using Docker and Singularity, enabling reproducible scientific pipelines.

tools.name: packrat
tools.one_line_profile: Dependency management system for reproducible R scientific analysis
tools.detailed_description: A dependency management tool for the R programming language, widely used in statistical computing and bioinformatics. It ensures that R projects are self-contained, portable, and reproducible by isolating package dependencies, which is critical for scientific research workflows.

tools.name: spack-manager
tools.one_line_profile: Management tool for Spack deployments in HPC environments
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by Sandia National Laboratories to manage the deployment of software stacks using Spack (a package manager for supercomputers). It facilitates the creation and maintenance of reproducible software environments on High Performance Computing (HPC) systems.

tools.name: docker-selkies-egl-desktop
tools.one_line_profile: Containerized KDE desktop with EGL support for HPC visualization
tools.detailed_description: A specialized Docker container providing a KDE Plasma desktop environment optimized for Kubernetes and HPC clusters. It supports OpenGL EGL for NVIDIA GPUs, enabling low-latency remote visualization of scientific applications and simulations via WebRTC.

tools.name: docker-selkies-glx-desktop
tools.one_line_profile: Containerized KDE desktop with GLX support for HPC visualization
tools.detailed_description: A specialized Docker container providing a KDE Plasma desktop environment optimized for Kubernetes and HPC clusters. It supports OpenGL GLX for NVIDIA GPUs, enabling low-latency remote visualization of scientific applications and simulations via WebRTC.

tools.name: selkies
tools.one_line_profile: WebRTC-based remote desktop streaming platform for HPC and Cloud
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform for low-latency, accelerated remote desktop streaming using WebRTC and HTML5. It is designed for self-hosting on Kubernetes or HPC clusters to provide remote access to graphical scientific applications and visualization workloads.

tools.name: wave-cli
tools.one_line_profile: CLI for Wave container provisioning service in scientific workflows
tools.detailed_description: The command-line interface for the Wave container provisioning service, developed by Seqera Labs (creators of Nextflow). It enables on-the-fly container creation and augmentation for scientific workflows, facilitating reproducible bioinformatics and data science pipelines.

tools.name: docker2singularity
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for Docker images to Singularity format for HPC
tools.detailed_description: A utility tool that converts Docker container images into Singularity images. This is essential for HPC workflows where Docker is used for development but Singularity (Apptainer) is required for runtime execution on shared clusters.

tools.name: singularity-deploy
tools.one_line_profile: Deployment tool for Singularity containers to GitHub Releases
tools.detailed_description: A CI/CD utility designed to build and deploy Singularity container images directly to GitHub releases. It streamlines the distribution of scientific software containers, making them easily accessible for HPC users.

tools.name: singularity-hpc
tools.one_line_profile: Local container registry manager for HPC environments
tools.detailed_description: A tool for managing a local filesystem registry of Singularity containers, specifically designed for HPC environments. It integrates with Lmod or Environment Modules to allow users and admins to easily manage and load containerized scientific applications.

tools.name: singularity-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python API and CLI for Singularity container management
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and command-line interface for interacting with Singularity containers and Singularity Hub. It allows researchers to automate the management, inspection, and execution of Singularity containers within Python-based scientific workflows.

tools.name: sregistry
tools.one_line_profile: Singularity Registry Server for scientific container storage
tools.detailed_description: An open-source registry server specifically designed for storing and managing Singularity images. It allows institutions and research groups to host their own private or public container registries, facilitating the sharing and reproducibility of scientific environments.

tools.name: Spack
tools.one_line_profile: A flexible package manager for HPC supporting multiple versions, configurations, platforms, and compilers
tools.detailed_description: Spack is a package manager designed for high-performance computing (HPC) environments. It enables reproducible scientific software stacks by handling complex dependency graphs, supporting multiple compiler versions, and allowing coexistence of different library configurations, which is critical for scientific simulations and data analysis.

tools.name: Spyder
tools.one_line_profile: The Scientific Python Development Environment
tools.detailed_description: Spyder is a powerful scientific environment written in Python, for Python, and designed by and for scientists, engineers and data analysts. It features a unique combination of the advanced editing, analysis, debugging, and profiling functionality of a comprehensive development tool with the data exploration, interactive execution, deep inspection, and beautiful visualization capabilities of a scientific package.

tools.name: SSRS
tools.one_line_profile: Semantic Segmentation for Remote Sensing imagery
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning toolkit specifically designed for semantic segmentation tasks in remote sensing. It provides implementations of various segmentation models tailored for earth observation data analysis.

tools.name: Pinocchio
tools.one_line_profile: Rigid Body Dynamics algorithms and their analytical derivatives
tools.detailed_description: A fast and flexible C++ library for rigid body dynamics computations. It is widely used in robotics, biomechanics, and physics simulations to calculate kinematics and dynamics efficiently.

tools.name: MedAgentBench
tools.one_line_profile: A Realistic Virtual EHR Environment to Benchmark Medical LLM Agents
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite that provides a realistic virtual Electronic Health Record (EHR) environment to evaluate the performance and capabilities of Medical Large Language Model (LLM) agents in clinical scenarios.

tools.name: SingularityCE
tools.one_line_profile: Container platform optimized for HPC and scientific computing
tools.detailed_description: Singularity (now SingularityCE/Apptainer) is a container platform designed specifically for High Performance Computing (HPC). It allows researchers to package their scientific workflows, software, and data into a single image that can be run reproducibly on various HPC clusters without requiring root privileges.

tools.name: Konda
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight utility for managing Conda environments within Google Colab sessions
tools.detailed_description: Konda is a Python utility designed to bridge the gap between Google Colab's default runtime and the Conda package management system. It allows researchers to easily install and persist Conda environments in Colab, enabling the use of scientific libraries and tools that are not available via standard pip installations or require complex dependency resolution.

tools.name: Recipe Wizard
tools.one_line_profile: Dockerfile generator for hardware-accelerated scientific simulation environments
tools.detailed_description: Recipe Wizard is a tool that automates the creation of Dockerfiles for complex scientific simulation setups. It specifically targets headless server environments requiring OpenGL (GLX), nvidia-docker2 (CUDA), ROS (Robot Operating System), and Gazebo, streamlining the deployment of robotics and physics simulations.

tools.name: Banpei
tools.one_line_profile: Anomaly detection library based on Singular Spectrum Transformation
tools.detailed_description: Banpei is a Python library dedicated to anomaly detection in time-series data using the Singular Spectrum Transformation (SST) method. It provides a simple interface for change-point detection, applicable to scientific monitoring and signal processing tasks.

tools.name: Videoflow
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for building multiprocessing video analysis pipelines
tools.detailed_description: Videoflow is a Python framework designed to facilitate the rapid development of complex video analysis applications. It handles multiprocessing and flow execution, allowing researchers to focus on implementing computer vision algorithms and processing logic for scientific video data.

tools.name: ipyvizzu
tools.one_line_profile: Animated data visualization library for Jupyter notebooks
tools.detailed_description: ipyvizzu is a tool that enables the creation of animated, interactive charts within Jupyter notebooks and other Python environments. It allows scientists to build data stories and visualize complex dataset transitions, enhancing the interpretability and presentation of research findings.

tools.name: Warewulf
tools.one_line_profile: Stateless and diskless container operating system provisioning system for HPC clusters
tools.detailed_description: Warewulf is a scalable systems management and provisioning suite specifically designed for High Performance Computing (HPC) clusters. It facilitates the deployment of stateless and diskless container-based operating systems to bare metal hardware, essential for scientific computing infrastructure.

tools.name: UltraLight VM-UNet
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Vision Mamba network for skin lesion segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight medical image segmentation model that integrates Vision Mamba into a U-Net architecture. It is specifically designed for skin lesion segmentation tasks, offering reduced parameter count while maintaining performance.

tools.name: S-D-Mamba
tools.one_line_profile: Mamba-based model for time series forecasting
tools.detailed_description: An implementation evaluating and utilizing the Mamba architecture for time series forecasting tasks. It serves as a solver for scientific data analysis involving temporal sequences.

tools.name: conda-envs (InSAR)
tools.one_line_profile: Conda environment configurations for InSAR data processing
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Conda environment setup scripts and configurations specifically tailored for Interferometric Synthetic Aperture Radar (InSAR) data processing workflows on Linux and macOS.

tools.name: MambaOut
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient vision backbone architecture analyzing Mamba's necessity
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the MambaOut architecture, which empirically analyzes the necessity of Mamba blocks in vision tasks. It serves as a computer vision backbone for scientific image analysis.

tools.name: Sigma
tools.one_line_profile: Siamese Mamba Network for Multi-Modal Semantic Segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model implementing a Siamese Mamba Network for multi-modal semantic segmentation (e.g., RGB-Thermal, RGB-Depth). Useful for scientific sensing and robotics perception tasks.

tools.name: Mamba-UNet
tools.one_line_profile: Zoo of Mamba-UNet models for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A collection (Zoo) of Mamba-integrated U-Net architectures designed for medical image segmentation tasks. It provides reusable model implementations for biomedical image analysis.
